title: What if Democrats’ Big Shutdown Loss Turns Out to Be a Win?
summary: Despite considerable hand-wringing in the party about caving to Republicans in the government closure, some Democrats see potential upsides in the outcome.

title: As Shutdown Nears End, Trump Still Confronts Soaring Health Costs
summary: The central issue of the government closure remains unresolved, leaving Republicans under political pressure ahead of the midterms.

title: Duffy Won’t Give Timeline to Restore Flights as Shutdown Appears Near End
summary: The transportation secretary said data would guide the decision. He also stepped up his warnings of potential chaos, saying some airlines could ground their fleets if the shutdown continued.

title: Johnson to Seat Grijalva, Seven Weeks After She Was Elected
summary: Speaker Mike Johnson had refused to swear in Representative-elect Adelita Grijalva, a Democrat of Arizona, claiming he lacked the power to do so.

title: Xi’s Military Purges Show Unease About China’s Nuclear Forces
summary: The shake-up in China’s armed forces comes as both Beijing and Washington are pushing through major changes in their country’s militaries, in different ways.

title: Newsom in the Spotlight at the Climate Conference That Trump Decided to Skip
summary: The California governor painted the president as a threat to American competitiveness by letting China dominate the renewable energy industry.

title: There’s a New Forecast for Peak Oil Demand. It’s Increasingly Cloudy.
summary: The International Energy Agency once projected that oil and gas demand could level off by 2030. Now it’s backing off, sort of.

title: Senator Criticizes Rubio for Paying $7.5 Million to Equatorial Guinea to Take Deportees
summary: Senator Jeanne Shaheen, Democrat of New Hampshire, said the African country has a long history of corruption. The amount paid is far more than recent annual assistance given to it.

title: States That Rely on the Colorado River Miss Deadline to Agree on Cuts
summary: A plan to sustainably manage the shrinking waterway could soon be up to the Trump administration — or eventually the Supreme Court.

title: Jack Schlossberg, Social Media Provocateur, Gives Politics a Try
summary: As he prepares a Congressional run, J.F.K.’s grandson admits, “I’m not for everybody.”

title: Jack Schlossberg, Kennedy Heir, to Seek Nadler’s N.Y. Congressional Seat
summary: Mr. Schlossberg, the son of Caroline Kennedy, said the Democratic Party needed someone who could stand up to President Trump and his allies.

title: Why Factories Will Keep Looking for Alternatives to China
summary: A trade truce between the United States and China has calmed nerves, but it won’t stop the broader movement of companies to countries like Vietnam.

title: What It Takes to Move a Factory From China to Vietnam
summary: Tariffs have forced Chinese companies to move their operations to Vietnam. Alexandra Stevenson, our Shanghai bureau chief, visits a factory in Ho Chi Minh City to see how one of the biggest challenges isn’t relocating machinery and tools, but overcoming language barriers.

title: Halt in Fees on Chinese Vessels Endangers U.S. Shipbuilding Efforts
summary: The two countries agreed to suspend the fees for a year as part of their recent trade pact, but America still aims to build more commercial ships.

title: Archbishop Paul Coakley Is Picked to Lead American Bishops
summary: “We face a growing worldview that is so often at odds with the Gospel mandate to love thy neighbor,” the group said in a letter to Pope Leo.

title: Key Netanyahu Minister Steps Down From Israel’s Government
summary: Ron Dermer, a longtime ally of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and an influential figure in the Israeli government throughout the war in Gaza, resigned as minister of strategic affairs.

title: Israel Arrests 4 After Jewish Extremist Attack in West Bank
summary: Dozens of masked Israelis attacked an industrial zone, torching vehicles and wounding Palestinians, according to Palestinian officials.

title: Justice Department to Investigate Protests at Turning Point Event at Berkeley
summary: The announcement came a day after protesters confronted attendees of a campus event hosted by Turning Point USA, the conservative group founded by Charlie Kirk.

title: Cleto Escobedo III, Jimmy Kimmel’s Bandleader, Dies at 59
summary: Mr. Kimmel said that he and Mr. Escobedo, who led Cleto and the Cletones on “Jimmy Kimmel Live!,” had been “inseparable since I was 9 years old.”

title: Meet the New Antisemites, Same as the Old Antisemites
summary: A bigotry for morons will always be political gold in a world of morons.

title: Steve Bannon Thinks Zohran Mamdani Is a Genius. It’s Not a Feint.
summary: Key elements of the mayor-elect’s campaign have enormous potential for a party that was badly beaten in 2024.

title: Trump Threatened to Sue the BBC for $1 Billion. What Are His Chances?
summary: Legal experts say President Trump’s litigation track record offers both hope and warning to the British public broadcaster, which he has threatened with a $1 billion suit.

title: Infant Formula Recall Expands as Botulism Outbreak Grows
summary: Federal health officials said caregivers should stop using all ByHeart powdered formula products after 15 infants in 12 states were hospitalized.

title: How a New Bridge Partly Collapsed in China’s Southwest
summary: A section of the tall bridge in mountainous Sichuan Province fell, apparently after a landslide. No casualties were reported.

title: Kansas County Agrees to Pay $3 Million Over Police Raid of Newspaper
summary: The search of The Marion County Record’s office in 2023 touched off a national conversation about press freedom.
